channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Ohio State University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Automating Data Annotation under Strategic Human Agents: Risks and Potential Solutions
item.description: AI models retraining with model-annotated data incorporating human strategic responses can lead to unexpected outcomes, potentially reducing the proportion of agents with positive labels over time, wh…

item.title: FedNE: Surrogate-Assisted Federated Neighbor Embedding for Dimensionality Reduction
item.description: FEDNE: a novel approach enabling collaborative dimensionality reduction of distributed data in federated learning without data sharing, achieved via surrogate loss functions and data augmentation.

item.title: Fine-Tuning is Fine, if Calibrated
item.description: Fine-tuning pre-trained models often degrades performance on unseen classes. This work reveals that the problem stems from logit scale discrepancies, not feature loss, and shows that post-processing c…

item.title: HippoRAG: Neurobiologically Inspired Long-Term Memory for Large Language Models
item.description: HippoRAG, a neurobiologically inspired framework, dramatically improves LLM long-term memory and multi-hop question answering by synergistically orchestrating LLMs, knowledge graphs, and the Personali…

item.title: pcaGAN: Improving Posterior-Sampling cGANs via Principal Component Regularization
item.description: pcaGAN boosts posterior-sampling cGANs by using principal component regularization, achieving faster, more accurate results in various imaging tasks.

item.title: Private Algorithms for Stochastic Saddle Points and Variational Inequalities: Beyond Euclidean Geometry
item.description: This paper presents novel, privacy-preserving algorithms achieving near-optimal rates for solving stochastic saddle point problems and variational inequalities in non-Euclidean geometries.

item.title: Probabilistic size-and-shape functional mixed models
item.description: This study introduces a novel Bayesian functional mixed model that reliably recovers the size and shape of fixed effects from noisy functional data with phase variability, outperforming current state-…
